description: Human dev. in BiH tackling the most pressing local/rural dev.challenges for the country (Improved local governance, Poverty reduc. through employment and income generation and integration of the most vulner. groups in soc. and dev. processes)

subproject.description:
The Srebrenica Regional Recovery Programme, a multi-donor initiative, is an integrated and comprehensive framework, which seeks to revitalize the human and physical capital of the region. The expected output of the project is:
- Municipalities, local development organisations and private sector are capable of planning and implementing their own path to sustainable human development in order to effectively overcome the multi-dimensional barriers to poverty reduction.


The overall goal of the Srebrenica Regional Recovery Programme is to promote the socio-economic recovery of multiethnic communities with strengthened local government structures. The Programme will focus on the following expected output: 
- Municipalities and local development organisations are capable of planning and implementing their own path to sustainable human development in order to effectively overcome the multi-dimensional barriers to poverty reduction.


In its third phase, the programme’s focus will be on supporting the local partners in creating an enabling environment for local economic development, defined as the efforts that seek to improve the economic well-being and quality of life for a community. 


To do so, the Srebrenica Regional Recovery Programme is designed around four activities that will address the needs to:
- develop leadership and technical competencies;
- strengthen local governments and public institutions;
- improve public services including public infrastructures; and
- develop the private sector to create employment.

The four planned activities are:
1.	Local Capability Development
2.	Institutional Strengthening
3.	Services to Citizens
4.	Private Sector Development


The second emphasis of the programme’s third phase will be on the transfer of the implementation responsibilities to the municipal authorities. Through this transfer of implementation responsibilities, the programme intends to strengthen local human and institutional capacity development. Such a modality enables local partners to increase their competencies in implementing complex development interventions with UNDP providing mentoring and coaching services. This modality also leads to increased local ownership over the programme’s implementation.


The expected results of the four activities are:
- Increased local capabilities in participatory planning and implementation of development projects;
- Increased effectiveness in the delivery of public services;
- More than 6,000 people will benefit from improved living conditions; and
- 500 families have increased revenues.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Srebrenica Regional Recovery P

subproject.title: Srebrenica Regional Recovery P

subproject.description: In addressing the three main challenges for local development mentioned above, the LDP is organised around five desired outcomes, which are sought to be achieved: 1. The empowerment of local community stakeholder’s to respond to long-term development challenges (improved local governance), 2. Economic development for sustainable employment and income generation, particularly through rural development and tourism, 3. Social inclusion of vulnerable and excluded groups, 4. Technical Documentation Fund and Priority Projects, 5. Energy and Environment. An overview of the activities to be achieved which are designed to lead to those outcomes is provided below: Output 1:  Local authorities’ capacities for planning and citizen services increased, Output 2:  Economic development for sustainable employment and income generation, particularly through rural development and tourism, enhanced, Output 3:  Social inclusion of vulnerable and excluded groups improved, Output 4:  Skills of the local government authorities developed and priority projects implemented, Output 5:  Capacities on Energy Efficiency and Environment Improved
subproject.title: Local Development Mostar

subproject.description:
In addressing the three main challenges for local development mentioned above, the Local Development Programme is organised around five desired outcomes, which are sought to be achieved:
1. The empowerment of local community stakeholder’s to respond to long-term development challenges (improved local governance)
2. Economic development for sustainable employment and income generation
3. Social inclusion of vulnerable and excluded groups
4. Technical Documentation Fund and Priority Projects
5. Energy and Environment

An overview of the activities to be achieved which are designed to lead to those outcomes is provided below:
Output 1: Local authorities’ capacities for planning and citizen services improved
Output 2:  Economic development for sustainable employment and income generation
Output 3:  Social inclusion of vulnerable and excluded groups 
Outcome 4: Technical Documentation Fund and Priority Projects
Output 5:  Capacities on Energy Efficiency and Environment Strengthened
